intro: Solanum indicum subsp. clinocarpum, commonly known as the Indian nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are berries that start green and turn red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
